revised_title: Exploring Plant Resistance Mechanisms Against Bacteria
tldr: The authors discuss the various mechanisms of disease resistance in plants against bacteria. They categorize resistance systems into constitutive and induced systems. Constitutive systems involve pre-formed compounds that are toxic to bacteria or a combination of adverse physiological factors. Induced resistance systems include the hypersensitive reaction and the protective response. The authors provide examples of these resistance mechanisms in bacterial stalk-rot of corn and bacterial wilt caused by Pseudomonas solanacearum.
